results.title: The Empty frame
results.brief_description: The biography of Robert Goddard and the history of the development of rocketry. Shows how Goddard’s research and developmental work, with respect to rocketry, made possible the great space exploration vehicles of today. Includes archival footage

results.title: The Empty Beach
results.creator_credit: Jethro Films, Timothy Read, John Edwards and Chris Thomson
results.brief_description: Bryan Brown is Cliff Hardy, private investigator, in “The Empty Beach”, a powerful Australian crime thriller based on the novel by Peter Corris. It begins as a routine investigation into a supposed drowning. But Hardy soon found himself running for his life in the seedy, violent underworld of Sydney’s playground, Bondi. An involving journey into the corrupt underworld of Sydney, “The Empty Beach” also stars Anna Maria Monticelli, Ray Barrett, Nick Tate and Belinda Giblin.

results.title: The Empire strikes back (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The battle to save the galaxy from the evil Darth Vader rages on in this spellbinding Star Wars sequel. In a spectacular opening battle the Rebels suffer a devastating attack by an Imperial Army using ATAT walkers. Hans Solo, Princess Leia and Chewbacca survive, and fight a running space battle against Imperial ships while Luke Skywalker seeks out Yoda, the ancient Jedi Master, to be trained as a true Jedi Knight. Rated: PG Caption Version only Available.

results.title: The Empire strikes back
results.creator_credit: Lucasfilm, Ltd., Gary Kurtz and Irvin Kershner
results.brief_description: The second of the “Star wars trilogy” is a blacker film than the previous “Star Wars.” The Rebel Alliance, defeated by the Empire on the ice planet of Hoth, must seek refuge elsewhere in order to re-group. Luke Skywalker goes to the planet of Dagobah to complete his training with the Jedi Master, Yoda. Hans, Leia and Chewbacca escape, but the evil reach of the Empire means that a confrontation between good and evil is inevitable. Luke as a fledgling Jedi, must face Darth Vader, who uses a terrible secret and the power of the Dark Side of the Force, to lure Luke to destruction. Includes a ten minute interview between Leonard Maltin and George Lucas.

results.title: The Emperor moth
results.brief_description: Shows the life-cycle of the Emperor Moth from the laying of eggs to the final emergence of the moth from the pupal case. The making of the cocoon is shown in detail.

results.title: The Emperor and the nightingale
results.creator_credit: Rabbit Ears Productions, Windham Hill, Joel Tuber and Mark Sottnick
results.brief_description: Glenn Close narrates Hans Christian Andersen’s story of the Chinese emperor who discovers that the song of a free nightingale, is more beautiful and more valuable by far, than the finest and cleverest, bejewelled mechanical singing bird. The exquisite illustrations are by Robert Van Nutt and the evocative music is by Mark Isham.

results.title: The Emperor and the assassin
results.creator_credit: New Wave Entertainmnet, Beijing Film Studio, Chen Kaige, Shirley Kao and Satoru Iseki
results.brief_description: The most expensive film produced in China at its date of production, this historical epic is based on the event of the forced unification of China in the third century. By 221 BC, after centuries of civil war, seven kingdoms were dominant in China. At this time the ruler of the kingdom of Qin, Ying Zheng (Li Xuejian), raised to believe he had an ancestral duty to unify all of China, undertook a brutal conquest to achieve his goal, thus becoming the country’s first emperor. In this interpretation Zheng is aided in his quest by his lover, Lady Zhao (Gong Li), who devises a fake assassination plot to justify an invasion of the neighboring kingdom of Yan, enlisting the help of Yan assassin Jing Ke (Zhang Fengyi) who is trying to give up his bloody past. As the King becomes increasingly ruthless and bloodthirsty, Lady Zhao shifts her political and romantic allegiances to the assassin. Filled with the back-stabbing imperial politics, murderous betrayals, acts of cruelty and bloody mass slaughter usually associated with Shakespearean tragedy, the emotional impact and tension of the complex narrative is at times dwarfed by the elaborately staged, large-scale battle sequences and the visual grandeur of the landscape. Written by Chen Kaige and Wang Peigong. Photography, Zhao Fei, music, Zhao Jiping.

results.title: The Emperor's oblong pancake. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Fine Arts and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An animated version of the story by Peter Hughes about the emperor who tried to change all the round objects in his kingdom into oblong ones. Narrated by Edward Everett Horton. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Emperor's new groove
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Randy Fullmer and Mark Dindal
results.brief_description: Emperor Kuzco is an arrogant and selfish leader and his latest plan involves destroying a hill top village to build a summer palace. He invites village elder Pancha in to discuss options, but only to find out the best place to get the sun. When the amnesiac emperor awakes to find himself turned into a llama, he blames the kindly Pancho, unaware that his conniving advisor, the wizened Yzma, and brawny brainless sidekick Kronk, have usurped his power. Demanding he be returned to the palace, Kuzco pushes Pancha’s faith that to the limit that all human beings possess goodness. Featuring the voices of David Spade, John Goodman, Eartha Kitt, Patrick Warburton, Wendie Malick and music by Tom Jones and Sting, this witty Disney animation espouses the virtues of friendship and kindness to others.
